Reviews.Title: “STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: South-OC-family
Reviews.Content: It was an absolute dream. Get off at Zaccaria stop from the water taxi, and at that point its pretty easy to find (which is saying a lot for Venice). The small, boutique-feel of the hotel was amazing, the staff bent over backwards to help us with travel advice, restaurant recommendations (and reservations) etc. The room was exquisite... there were 4 in our family so we got a bigger room and had a view / balcony looking down onto the bustling streets of Venice, which was quite fun. The courtyard was a great place to relax after a day of sightseeing. Breakfast was very good...The location was as good as any I can imagine, centrally situated on a mini-canal with Gondoliers floating peacefully by... Admittedly, it was on the expensive side... but I'd still stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, I loved this place”
Reviews.Author: ChazzaBath
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my one night stay here. The staff we all very friendly, welcoming and helpful. The hotel is extremely well situated within a very short distance (50 metres) of St Marks Square, so you are in the very heart of historic Venice. This was very important to us as we had only about 36 hours in Venice so we needed to be within easy walking distance of all the main sights. My room was perhaps a little compact but was very clean, tidy, cosy and comfortable. My room was also very quiet indeed and I slept very well here. We paid about 180 euro for our room and I felt that for this location in Venice that was pretty good value. The hotel is attractively decorated throughout. Breakfast was very pleasant with a good buffet-style selection of bread, croissants, fruit, breakfast cereals, juice, coffee and so on. The hotel is quite atmospheric as it is right on a canal and you can get a gondola from the steps of the hotel if you wish. The hotel is also surrounded by restaurants and you will have no problem getting a good meal somewhere close. When I return to Venice, this hotel will be my top choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Oasis - excellent location near Piazza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: Californiadreamer227
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two daughters, teen and pre-teen, in this boutique hotel for three nights in one large 4 person room during the Easter break. The location was perfect for us - we really liked being close to Piazza San Marco (short walk to the San Marco vaporetto stop), but within a little neighborhood, right on a small canal. The room was lovely and felt new - decorated in gorgeous colors and traditional fabrics, with Fortuny lamps. Everything was spotlessly clean and the bed was very comfortable. We had one King bed and two single beds on either side of the room, one in a cute alcove. There were two good -sized clothes closets and a sitting area and desk/cabinet. Lovely draperies framed the large windows, which looked onto the courtyard. Breakfast was delicious - a nice buffet and good cappuccinos. Staff are friendly and helpful - there are guidebooks to review or borrow in the lobby, which was very useful as well. Easy to get to from San Marco vaporetto stop and easy access to water taxis to the airport. We loved staying here - it was an elegant oasis of calm in a busy, but magical city. It was so fun to step out the door and into a gondola - our daughters will always remember that!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best small hotels we have stayed!”
Reviews.Author: EllaMLondon
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in the beginning of February at Le Isole. This is certainly one of the best boutique hotels we have ever stayed. The location is perfect - very central, 5 min walk to San Marco, yet in a quiet location. I was slightly apprehensive as we had reserved the "economy double room", yet it turned out to be perfect: good proportions, enough storage space, comfortable bed, high-quality bed linen, modern shower room, everything immaculately clean and beautifully presented. We loved the combination of original building features, antique furniture pieces and modern, tranquil design. We appreciated having very little surcharge for the minibar items as well. The hotel staff were wonderful: helpful and very accommodating. Breakfast was delicious, with great choice of fruit, pastries, breads, hams and cheeses. Made-on-request expressos/capuccions/lattes.They even offer cooked breakfast at no extra charge. Overall, this hotel offers exceptional value, esp. for Venice. Both my husband and I were delighted to stay here and when we travel to Venice again, we'll make sure to stay at Le Isole.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: CluelessTraveller_90
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel based on the reviews here and I was very glad I did! Finding the hotel is very easy from San Zecceria ferry stop. Located right on the canal, there are little bridges and gondolas all around the hotel. Only 5 minute walk to San Marco Square and lots of cafe's and shops right outside the hotel. We booked a standard double room and it was perfect. The size wasn't huge, however it wasn't small either. We had a window opening to the canal and a little bridge below which was romantic. Service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, perfect for our engagement”
Reviews.Author: gt1949
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the excellent reviews and we can honestly say it turned out to be every bit as good, if not better than we imagined. My first contact with the hotel was when I emailed them a week before our trip. As I was planning on proposing to my now fiancÃ©e whilst we were in Venice I wanted it to be a very special occasion so asked the hotel if there was anything they could do to make our stay special. They replied very promptly and said they would put some flowers and a bottle of Prosecco in our room asking when I would Like this to be done, to which I replied it would be great if they could have everything in place when we returned from our meal on the first night. They lived up to their word and without any reminder from me, we returned from our first meal in Venice and a successful proposal to find a lovely bunch of flowers and Prosecco in an ice bucket. Throughout our stay the staff were brilliant, very friendly, polite and informative. Nothing was too much trouble for them. They really did make our stay brilliant. The hotel itself was very nice with the rooms recently refurbished and absolutely spotless, as was the whole hotel. The room was spacious and modern with everything you could need. The breakfast was good, with a nice range of choices and I would recommend eating in the courtyard which is a lovely place to sit of a morning or evening. The location of the hotel was also great with a two minute walk to the beautiful Piazza San Marco and only about a 10 minute walk to the Rialto, if you don't get lost down the many canal streets but that is half the fun. I can't say enough about how good the hotel is and in particular the staff. I would recommend anyone travelling to Venice to stay at Hotel Le Isole, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Venice”
Reviews.Author: malayar
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Isole is a charming 3-star property conveniently located near the centre of Venice. Local tourist attractions such as Giardini Pubblici, Parco delle Rimembranze and Lido Beach are not far from the hotel. Also easily within reach are Church of the Most Holy Redeemer (Chiesa del Santissimo Redentore), San NicolÃ² al Lido and La Giudecca.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent representation of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: denverprincessaj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and the service was impeccable. Our room had tall, vaulted ceilings and gorgeous antique furniture. It was very clean and well-maintained. Morning complimentary hot/cold breakfasts were excellent, and we particularly enjoyed the cappuccino out on the private terrace. Staff went above and beyond to assure an enjoyable stay. Only two minor drawbacks, neither negatively impacting our stay. The location is a bit difficult to find, and we were lucky to find a local to lead the way. Also, we weren't able to get the air conditioning system to function properly, so opened windows instead. Getting to the hotel from the vaporettos: Take the #1 bus and get off on the 2nd (last) S. Marco stop. Take a left and then go over the bridge. Take a right in the alley Calle del Vin, which is right before a money exchange store and after a restaurant. It jaunts to the left than follow that to the canal, turn right and follow the canal. The hotel will be on the right, and can be identified by the name on the hotel rug just inside the doorway, not a sign outside the building. Wonderful hotel overall, highly recommended and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming experience in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ancrene
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all our expectations: warm, cosy and well-equipped hotel in the very center of Venice, only 5 min walking from San Marco and San Zaccaria vaporetto stop, you can see gongolas from you window from one side and have a shopping area with restaurants from the other. And it's easy to find, because finding the way to your hotel is kind of tricky in Venice, especially at night. The room was spacious with comfortable bed, warm bathroom (it's very important because you feel shivery all the time in Venice in winter) with a real bath, not just shower. Breakfast was normal, they have a small patio and you can eat outside in summer. Staff was extremely nice and hepful we got a lot of smiles from them, if you travelled in Italy before you know what I'm talking about=)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Le Islole”
Reviews.Author: MadreMurcia
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break in Venice. The Hotel Le Isole was everything we hoped for. great location, friendly and efficient staff and a great location. The breakfast was excellent and everywhere was spotless. Thankyou to all the staff for making our stay so comfortable

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for our trip to Venice in Jan 2012”
Reviews.Author: Jacquie M
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading the fantastic reviews on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. Firstly the location was ideal - a three minute walk from San Zaccaria vaporetto stop, maybe 5 mins walk to San Marco, central to many bars, restaurants etc. The room itself was clean, well presented with a fantastic shower/ bath. The concierge was more than happy to assist with anything we needed, recommendations for places to eat etc. Particularly, his suggestion that we try Gatto Nero in Burano led us to our best meal in Venice and a wonderful day. We couldn't be happier with our choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Klara R
Reviews.Content: It was clean, quiet, and a pleasent experience. we'll come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irishowned
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in June 2011 and had a ball. The Hotel is beautifull right in the heart of Venice everything is right beside you. The staff were more than helpful and the Hotel itself was spotless. Venice is the most beautifuland magical place in the world. The rooms were exceptional they are small but beautifully decorated and very modern. The courtyard is gorgeous also. When i return i will definatly stay in Le Isole Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and charming ambience!”
Reviews.Author: Suthida3
Reviews.Content: What a cozy and charming hotel!! Room is super clean and bathroom is very new. This hotel is full character and well-thought design and service such as made-to-order breakfast (best croissant we gad) and free coffee and tea, etc. The staffs at reception are excellent. Best value for money! The only downside is it is a bit tricky to find. Other than that, it is just venice's hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoleneZ
Reviews.Content: We loved the modern feel of the hotel. The polymer wood flooring, decor and furnishing were stylish and well-appointed throughout the hotel, especially the breakfast room and lobby. For breakfast, there were both the cold buffet spread and hot items, such as omelette and bacon, that were cooked to order. Both were included in our room rate. Service was excellent - each member of staff obviously took pride in the hotel and did their best to facilitate the guests. While the room and bathroom were not spacious, this was to be expected in Venice. Our room was on the first floor and the window overlooked a busy thoroughfare and a pizzeria. Nevertheless, we were not troubled by noise due to the effective soundproofing of the double-glazed windows. The bed was comfortable. There were TV channels in English and best of all, free wi-fi. The location was fantastic, just off St Mark's Square. Plenty of eatery and delightful shops around. You can also take the gondola which can reach up to the hotel's doorstep if you wish to (we did not). The water-bus station for the Alilaguna line to the airport was also within walking distance and this was a key point for us as Venice was our last stop in Italy and we could reach the airport easily from here. As I write this review, I note that the hotel has changed its address (or rather street name). The new street name is more apt - the front door is actually from Fondamenta del vin and not Campo San Provolo, as previously indicated (we had some trouble locating it when we first arrived). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Todd p
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful room, air conditioning that really works on those hot days.We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: EllieO
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from four days in Venice. Le Isole is a small hotel in an excellent location - prebook the waterbus from the airport (it's cheaper) and get off at S Zaccaria. It's then a walk across the waterfront to a small alleyway Calle del Vin next to the bridge on the left, up the alley, go left then right and the hotel is alongside the canal near to the bridge. So easy and very quick. It's also very close to the main sites, eg, a short walk back to the waterfront then right for St Mark's Square. Checking in was quick and efficient (friendly staff) and we were given access information for the free WiFi. It's a small hotel. We got a standard room which looked out on a narrow courtyard area. Not exciting as views in Venice go, but it didn't matter as we weren't there to look out the window! The room was small but very well furnished and clean. The bed is king size, there are two narrow wardrobes, a safe, mini bar, TV with European Sky, two chairs and a table. The bathroom is also small but the shower (no bath) is excellent: hot water, good water pressure, two shower heads (detachable wand on the wall plus a rainfall shower head above). Breakfast is the usual selection of juice, fresh pastries, fruit (tinned but still nice), cold meats, yoghurt, cereal. You can have bacon and scrambled egg cooked if you want. A decent selection of teas and the usual variations for coffee. Other reviews note that this hotel has recently been refurbished and it shows. Everything looks smart. I really couldn't fault this hotel and was grateful for the previous reviews which helped me choose it. I hope you enjoy it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Aelwyn
Reviews.Content: I selected the Hotel Le Isole based on the words of my fellow Trip Advisor reviewers and it lived up to the excellent reputation illustrated in the reviews and then some. The staff was more than wonderful and, after only two days there, they felt more like friends. Their accommodating style was genuine and comfortable and it's really the friendly service that draws you right in. The place itself is stylish and fresh. Our room, The Murano, was nice and overlooked a narrow street and a small bridge which crosses a canal. The location of the hotel is perfect as it is only steps from Piazza San Marco and the vaporetto. Breakfast is simple but tasty and again, it's the service that will win you over. The lovely young lady who serves in the breakfast room is always smiling, eager to please and makes a mean cappuccino. Coffee and tea service is available in the breakfast room day and night and those little lemon cookies are delicious! Venice is an easy weekend getaway from where I live. I've been there before but usually stay elsewhere and day trip Venice. Now that I've discovered this wonderful hotel, I will definitely stay in Venice proper next time I visit and moreover I will definitely stay at the Hotel Le Isole. I can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joebugs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a week at this hotel in April of this year. Great location, five minutes walk from St. Marks Square. Great service. Cordial staff. Breakfast was very good. Rooms excellent. Made our stay in Venice very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Taveldog
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Isole is a new hotel built inside of an old building. The hotel is located on a small canal just one short block from St Mark's sqaure and a half of a block from the grand canal. You can step out the door and board a gondola. We were in such a good location we could go anywherre walking or by water taxi or bus. We stayed for four nights. Hotel provide a free breakfast which was awesome. Fresh eggs and bacon and lots of other choices. Staff was very friendly and helpful. If you need a policman, an mbulance, a taxi or a bus they are all boats. We went from our cruise ship to our hotel by water bust and to the airport by water bus. What a magnificent city.. I would definitley stay here again. It was a great little hotel. Nothing is cheap in Venice but this hotel was a great value. Hotel was very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: Geoff M
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights but wish we had more time. The staff, amenities, location and overall quality all added to a wonderful experience. I cant recommend the Le Isole more highly - it is wonderful. The staff all speak excellent english and couldn't do enough for us. The rooms are relatively small, but for two people, perfect! Two steps from the front door is a canal - perfect for gondola's to drop you off after a quick cruise through Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel - value, location, service and room was outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Hemal J
Reviews.Content: We ended our 2 week vacation at this lovely hotel (Nov 3-6) and couldn't have asked for a nicer end to the trip. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel is very close to St. Marks and the Doge Palace. The rooms are spacious, clean and very comfortable. There is a nice assortment of breakfast each morning to satisfy all. Elaina was very kind in preparing a box breakfast for our early flight. All in all, I HIGHLY recommend this hotel located in San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “So close to everything but so calm and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Tradge99
Reviews.Content: We booked in for four nights and what a great choice. A simple 2 min walk from the San Zaccaria Alilaguna stop (blu line), and an absolute haven from the noise - but still only 2 mins walk from the Piazza and all the main sights. Hotel is brilliant, though the standard room was a bit small (we had Murano), with a lovely quiet courtyard which must be fab in warmer weather. There are also two really welcoming bars on the corners nearby. We had two days of rain, so were glad of the complimentary umbrellas in reception - still didn't stop us getting wet feet from the Aqua Alta! Thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to celebrate our 50th birthday”
Reviews.Author: warringtonclaret
Reviews.Content: Great location (plane to Marco Polo airport, water bus to San Zaccaria, 100m walk to hotel), great decor, great breakfast, great service. We had a standard room which was a tad small but perfectly formed (the larger rooms were fully booked, but probably worth spending a bit extra if they are available).

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Venice won't stay hidden for long”
Reviews.Author: NycBrett
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to book at this new-since-February hotel. Ideally located - 5 minute walk to Piazza San Marco, 1 minute to the vapporetto service/water taxis and maybe 15 minutes to the Rialto Bridge. The rooms are beautiful, clean, new and well appointed (and we skimped and got a first floor room), the service was extremely friendly and the breakfast is great (they offered to cook eggs & bacon). Oh and the shower was amazing! Beautiful tile with great water pressure. It was also very quiet at night which was a nice change from our previous hotel on Via Tornabuoni in Florence. The prices are in line with other hotels in Venice though cheap for such a perfect location. I would love to stay at this hotel again though I think it will be a much harder booking next time!

Reviews.Title: “perfect service, lovely breakfast, good location, quiet”
Reviews.Author: London_Travellers_09
Reviews.Content: I would definitely return to this hotel. It was just off the Riva, along a little canal, with the vaparetti stops 2 minutes' walk away. St Marks was also very close. I went for the Biennale at the Arsenale and the hotel is perfectly located for that too. The room was very comfortable with a very smart bathroom, with lots of hot water, a great shower, and in the bedroom, a comfortable double bed and lots of wardrobe space. There was even sky tv for those who want tv. There was double glazing so no noise at all from the busy street outside. The aircon worked really well and was not noisy. And breakfast was great - a big selection and proper Italian coffee as well as American style. There is free wifi too. The reception staff and the breakfast staff were lovely and welcoming. I felt that the staff were happy to work there. I got a good rate for this quality though would be happy to pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, boutique style and homely”
Reviews.Author: Fibreace380
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively new hotel with friendly check in staff, nicely appointed rooms and very clean (you could walk barefoot around the hotel...). You could take ACTV ferry #41/42/51/52 from the Venice Ferrovia train station and stop at St. Zaccaria. The hotel is within walking distance from the St Zaccaria stop. I would not think that the hotel is well sign-posted but in Venice, a little adventure in finding locations is to be expected. We had a GPS and that was handy. The hotel is next to St. Marco's square yet away from the hustle bustle of tourists. Gondolas pass the front of the hotel. The room we had was spacious with cable and good wireless internet connection. We were on the first floor but the room insulation was good. Breakfast was good and served in the hotel courtyard. A good way to start the day. For improvement: The shampoo and conditioner bottles were very difficult to open. Not very funny when you are already in the shower... Should provide body lotion and shower cap. There are no ramps from the road level into the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel excellent location”
Reviews.Author: John_FMontreal
Reviews.Content: Great small hotel 5 minutes from Piazza San Marco and just opened this year. Great service, great rooms well appointed and clean and spacious. Breakfast is served outside in little courtyard with good choices, eggs are also available upon request. Little canal in front of hotel door with gondola's going by, and very close to main attractions. Would most certainly recommend this hotel, and is fairly priced. Would stay here again. We were 4 in 1 room and were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant long weekend”
Reviews.Author: chuich
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia. Our family of three did not have a great start to our holiday as the BA flight was delayed for two hours which meant we arrived past midnight, hence transport from Marco Polo airport to the hotel was limited. We took a taxi from the airport to the waterbus station at Roma. This cost us 46 Euro which was not unreasonable. From there, we took a waterbus (vaporetto) to San Zaccaria station which is the closest to the hotel. I had printed instructions from the hotelâ€™s website (http://www.hotel-leisole.it/hotel_in_venice-48/hotel_near_san_marco) on how to get to the hotel but please be sure you know which waterbus Line you are using as the hotel instructions stated that we should cross the bridge on the â€˜rightâ€™ from the San Zaccaria station. This only applies if you take Line 1. Our line stopped at the other San Zaccaria station and we should have turned â€˜leftâ€™ (there are many bridges in Venice!!). No one was around to ask in the middle of the night and it was dark (and you needed to speak Italian anyway). We rang the hotel to inform them that we were late and a bit lost and the receptionist kindly came out to look for us. The hotel is tucked away, next to a small canal, the entrance to the hotel is quite small, with a rather insignificant hotel plaque on the wall, so you could miss it easily (see photos). The return journey was easier without any hassles and we took a waterbus direct from San Zaccaria station, to the airport for 15 Euro pp one way (25 Euro return) and it takes just over an hour. The hotel receptionist will be able to give you a schedule of times. We were able to store our luggage for the day at the hotel after checking out. This boutique hotel is in a great location, one minute from San Zaccaria station and three minutes from St Markâ€™s square. It is quiet, new, clean and tastefully decorated, modern with touches of Venetian grandeur. We had a room with a large double bed and a single bed for our daughter. The air conditioning made the room very comfortable. Our bathroom was a bit smaller than usual (probably tiny by American but not so by European standards, with a half sized bath). It was adequate for us and the shower was great. We watched BBC news on the Sky channels on the TV. You will need to get a username and password from reception for the free Wifi. Bedroom slippers, hair dryer, safe and fridge were available. The only thing missing for me in the room was tea/coffee making facilities. Breakfast was buffet with a good selection and a cooked breakfast was also offered. We ate enough not to need any lunch. Surprisingly the tea served was quite decent. The waitress was very efficient and helpful. The courtyard in the hotel was lovely to sit in, in the early mornings with a cup of cappuccino but got warm quite quickly. I agree with some of the reviewers that food and dining is expensive in Venice, unless you just eat pizza every evening. As the portions were small, even the set menus were not value for money as they usually only offer a pasta starter and a main with either a salad or vegetables, so by the time you add a desert and/or coffee, it could set you back more than 25-30 Euro pp. As it was very hot the three days we spent there, we were drinking bottled water by the bucket loads. Bottled water from the stalls were about 1 Euro a bottle, so my suggestion is to stock up at the Co-op near the hotel which is about 2-3 minutesâ€™ walk away. Uniquely there are quite a few drinking fountains around Venice, mainly in the squares in front of churches, where some people were happy to drink from or fill up their bottles. It was a lovely atmosphere in the evening at St Markâ€™s square when the Basilica and Doges Palace were lit up, but be prepared to pay 8 Euro for a coffee if you wish to sit outside the cafes by the square to enjoy their live outdoor music. Other evening entertainment includes the Opera House, Vivaldi concerts and a small theatre play, along with the bars. The hotel has a pocket map which was very useful for getting around with. If you intend to explore the numerous museums around Venice, it might be worthwhile getting the museum pass as it covers most but not all of them. You will also avoid some of the queues. At this time of year (July), St Markâ€™s square was heaving with tourists. Ask for info at the tourist office in the square which is situated at the far end along the shops and find out which ones are covered. It is worthwhile asking the ever helpful receptionist(s) at the hotel, where most things are, before you set off. The Clock Tower is a must as the views at the top are spectacular. We found the audio guide useful. There were also quite a few temporary smaller exhibitions around and we were fortunate to see the Dali exhibition. We did not feel it necessary to go on the numerous walking tours offered as we walked leisurely around at our own pace instead of being in huge groups. We only took one organised four hour tour to the Murano, Burano and Torcello islands. You can get a voucher at the hotel reception which you need to exchange for tickets at the booth where you board the boat or you can purchase the same price tickets there. Do shop around for your souvenirs as they vary in price for the same things. In fact, it was cheaper bartering in Venice (e.g. at Rialto bridge) than in the factory shop in Murano for some of the glass souvenirs. Prices were cheaper further away from the centre of Venice, e.g. at Caâ€™ dâ€™Oro. The gondola rides were pricey, 80-100 Euro for a gondola, so it might be worthwhile to share. Make sure you dress appropriately for the casino at San Marcuola if you intend to visit. Slot machines available from 11:00 and tables open at 15:30. If you have more time in Venice, you could go on a tour to the vineyards (available on Sat and Tues only) or a trip over to Lido for cycling along the beach. All in all a great short break in very comfortable accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “A calm, neat gem hidden close to San Marco. A boutique hotel that feels like home.”
Reviews.Author: QueridaPatricia
Reviews.Content: I would have loved this small, discrete, pristine, calm, sweet boutique hotel even if it were far away from everything and the staff would had been merely decent. However, not only is the place pretty and neat and so clean and calm, but also this hotel has one of the best, most helpful, nicest staffs I have dealt with in long while (I work in international acquisition, so I do get a lot of hotel time.) They would help you with the same great attitude at 6 am and at 10 pm. They would give you good advices about where to go and what to in Venice, and do whatever they can to make your stay pleasant and make you feel at home. The room was perfect. So calm and clean and complete and well put together. In general, the hotel and the deco make a good balance subduing the Venetian classic luxurious look (not my thing) and getting a calming, more modern but yet vintage look. The bathroom is gorgeous and pristine you can have a wonderful bath or a quick shower. The breakfast is fabulous, abundant, healthy. If you are into eggs (I am certainly not), they'll prepare you a great American breakfast, but if you are more into lighter meals, they offer great fruits, cereals, yogurts, bread, cheese, and meets. The patio where you can have breakfast is also a little beauty. Wireless internet is free and works well all the time. One of the most wonderful aspects of the hotel is that it is both silent and calm, and just a couple of blocks away from piazza San Marco. It is each to reach with the vaporetto, and it is a wonderful walk to almost anywhere in Venice. I'll stay at Hotel Le Isole the next time and all the times after that. It was a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic room, quiet, new. Perfect in all senses, our children loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LicaAndorra
Reviews.Content: The location just in front of a little canal. Elena, the waitress breakfast, was very very kind! All is new, quiet, modern... I'm a Venice passioned, is my third time visit. This time was the best, specially thanks to this little gem!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nel_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: Very close to St-Marco Square and vaporetto station. Breakfast Ã  volontÃ©, very good quality. Exceptionally clean. Very friendly staff. Our room was a bit small, but I supposed that's the smallest they have.... Internet seemed to be a problem in Italy, but the hotel staff was always very helpful with providing new usernames and passwords to be able to use the WiFi connection. You can ask as many as you need, and you need to ask separate ones for each user in case you are using ipods, iphones etc.
